text: We're teaming up with @Ro to make their free COVID-19 telehealth assessment available to all independent workers. Whether you work w/ @Uber, @UberEats, @Lyft, @DoorDash, @Postmates or others, we encourage you to take advantage of this resource to help you stay safe and healthy.

While most can shelter at home safely, some can't. That’s why we’re committing to provide 50,000 rides across 16 countries to ensure survivors of domestic violence have access to local shelters and other safe spaces. Learn more → https://ubr.to/domesticviolence

COVID-19 has disrupted existing transport options for many, yet some still must travel to receive care for chronic conditions. @UberHealth is working with partners, like digital health coaching company @Pack_Health, to help them reach their treatment centers.

While you’re not riding with us, we’re delivering on our pledge of 10 million free rides and deliveries of food for people in need around the world. Learn more → http://uber.com/coronavirus #MoveWhatMatters

We’re proud to partner with @NYCMayor and donate $1 million in rides and meals to support our healthcare workers and first responders on the frontlines of COVID-19 https://www.nydailynews.com/coronavirus/ny-coronavirus-uber-free-rides-food-health-care-workers-20200402-jgu5xqgslrbydlaedfk74a5pti-story.html #MoveWhatMatters

Stay home if you can. And with drivers, delivery people, and restaurants, we’ll help #MoveWhatMatters: 10 million free rides and deliveries of food for frontline healthcare workers, seniors, and people in need. Learn more → http://uber.com/coronavirus
We’re proud to partner with America's largest healthcare union @1199SEIU to provide free meals and discounted rides to the brave healthcare workers on the frontlines of COVID-19.

We can all help flatten the curve by staying home. If you must travel, follow these tips to help your community stay healthy and keep drivers safe. Share to let your friends and families know. Learn more → http://uber.com/coronavirus

We want to help ensure the safety of everyone in our cities while being available for essential travel needs. Because of this, we are reminding riders, with in-app messages, to travel only when necessary and take steps to protect themselves and their drivers.

Safety is always our priority. We are actively monitoring the Coronavirus situation and are taking steps to help keep our communities safe in all the cities that we serve. Learn more → http://uber.com/coronavirus
With our 24/7 support team, we’re always a tap, click or call away. It’s just one of the ways we’re working to make ridesharing safer. Learn more at http://uber.com/safety.

Verify Your Ride with PIN helps you get in the right car by providing users with a unique 4-digit PIN to start the ride. The safety feature is now being rolled out in: Australia Brazil Canada France Mexico UK And many more countries across the

Now with RideCheck, we can help detect if your trip has an unexpected stop and provide tools to get help. It’s just one of the ways we’re helping keep you safe. Learn more at http://uber.com/safety. Available in the US and rolling out to cities globally.

RideCheck, a new safety feature that uses sensors and GPS data to help detect if a trip goes unusually off-course is being rolled out in: Australia Canada Mexico New Zealand As well as many other countries globally

We put an Emergency Button in our app that quickly connects both riders and drivers to emergency assistance if you need urgent help. It’s just one of the ways we’re working to make ridesharing safer. Learn more → http://uber.com/safety.
On-trip reporting is now live in the US, so if you ever feel unsafe while on a trip, you can immediately and discreetly report it to our safety team. Learn more → http://ubr.to/on-trip-reporting

When you ride with Uber, all drivers are background checked before their first ride and screened on an ongoing basis. It’s just one of the ways we’re helping keep you safe. Learn more at http://uber.com/safety. Screening process differs by country.
The ultimate touchdown is getting there safely. Remember to plan your pre and post-game travel by calling a friend, requesting a ride or taking public transport. If you drink, don’t drive.

Today we’re releasing a new bike trip data tool that shows where and when cyclists are most active in our cities to help establish safer and better bike infrastructure. The data is available for SF, DC and Paris, with more cities coming in the future.

We’re launching a new safety feature in the & to help you get in the right ride. Here's how it works: The rider receives a unique 4 digit PIN for their ride in the app Rider shares PIN with driver The trip only begins in the app once the driver enters the right PIN
